definitions.text: an instance of change; the rate or magnitude of change
an activity that varies from a norm or standard
examples: any variation in his routine was immediately reported

definitions.text: a repetition of a musical theme in which it is modified or embellished
something a little different from others of the same type
examples: an experimental version of the night fighter
a variant of the same word
an emery wheel is the modern variation of a grindstone
the boy is a younger edition of his father

definitions.text: an artifact that deviates from a norm or standard
examples: he patented a variation on the sandal

definitions.text: the angle (at a particular location) between magnetic north and true north
the process of varying or being varied
(astronomy) any perturbation of the mean motion or orbit of a planet or satellite (especially a perturbation of the earth's moon)
(biology) an organism that has characteristics resulting from chromosomal alteration
(ballet) a solo dance or dance figure
the act of changing or altering something slightly but noticeably from the norm or standard
examples: who is responsible for these variations in taxation?
